gobblin.data.management.copy.writer

Class FileAwareInputStreamDataWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.instrumented.writer.InstrumentedDataWriter<FileAwareInputStream>
      • gobblin.data.management.copy.writer.FileAwareInputStreamDataWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SpeculativeAttemptAwareConstruct, Instrumentable, FinalState, DataWriter<FileAwareInputStream>, Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TarArchiveInputStreamDataWriter

    public class FileAwareInputStreamDataWriter
extends InstrumentedDataWriter<FileAwareInputStream>
implements FinalState, SpeculativeAttemptAwareConstruct
    A DataWriter to write FileAwareInputStream

      • actualProcessedCopyableFile

        protected Optional<CopyableFile> actualProcessedCopyableFile
        The copyable file in the WorkUnit might be modified by converters (e.g. output extensions added / removed). This field is set when InstrumentedDataWriter.write(D) is called, and points to the actual, possibly modified CopyEntity that was written by this writer.

      • writeImpl

        public final void writeImpl(FileAwareInputStream fileAwareInputStream)
                     throws IOException

      • writeImpl

        protected void writeImpl(InputStream inputStream,
                         Path writeAt,
                         CopyableFile copyableFile)
                  throws IOException
        Write the contents of input stream into staging path.

        WriteAt indicates the path where the contents of the input stream should be written. When this method is called, the path writeAt.getParent() will exist already, but the path writeAt will not exist. When this method is returned, the path writeAt must exist. Any data written to any location other than writeAt or a descendant of writeAt will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - FSDataInputStream whose contents should be written to staging path.
        writeAt - Path at which contents should be written.
        copyableFile - CopyEntity that generated this copy operation.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws IOException
        Moves the file from task staging to task output. Each task has its own staging directory but all the tasks share the same task output directory.
        Specified by:
